Stayed with kids
review_text: We really enjoyed staying here. The apartment is very cute and has lots of character, and it was comfortable. Check-in was easy, and Anthony graciously offered to give us a late check-out, which was incredibly helpful. The location is the best part--it's in downtown Mitchell and close to everything. Being right on top of a coffee shop was very fun too (even though it was closed when we were there). The only thing I'd caution is that there are some steep stairs to get to the apartment; they were a little hard for my 77-year-old mother, but she managed. I would stay here again!

They do ask you to get a load of laundry ready if you use towels which is unusual for Airbnbs as a whole as you pay a cleaning fee.

review_text: What a gem in Mitchell, SD! Off street parking was easy. Driving to El Columpio on the edge of town for dinner was a breeze -- and seriously delicious burritos (I live in Chicago, where there are hundreds of Mexican restaurants... and am now dreaming of El Columpio, wishing it had an outpost in my town...!). Would DEFINITELY stay again!

review_text: The location was convenient for a quick stopover, close to the corn palace, with clear instructions where to move the car overnight. We were a bit startled by a guy who came in and said he was checking on the AC right when we got there one hour after the check in time, but in all fairness the host had tried to contact me half an hour before check in, missed due to being on the road at that time. The dishwasher was still running, so I unloaded the dishes when they finished and reran what was visibly missed by the machine. I was awoken at 4am by what sounded like a critter scampering above or around the apartment and again by the coffee shop music below around 7. Floors weren’t the cleanest but they did match the rustic decor. All in all, a sufficient stopover with the basics.

review_text: Anthony’s place is a must if you’re staying in Mitchell. name: Ethan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Thanks to Anthony’s check in instructions, the spot was very easy to find.
The apartment itself is well equipped and very comfortable (even when it hit 106 degrees outside, the apartment stayed ice cold).
If you have to stop in Mitchell for any reason, you really can’t do much better than this. Just down the stairs there is a solid little coffee shop with good breakfast and coffee, and there are several bar/restaurant options within a couple blocks if you don’t feel like cooking any meals.
10/10 would stay here again and recommend to anyone looking for accommodations in Mitchell.
*** one word of advice to airbnb’ers, be sure to park where the listing says and/or check your street signs carefully! I got a $30 parking ticket parking on the wrong part of 3rd street, and the sign that indicated no parking was on the other side of the street and facing the opposite direction.

review_text: Selena describes her place as “cozy” but with 2 full size bedrooms, full kitchen and dining room and 2 living areas I'd say it was just right. The wife and I used Selena's place as a bridge between when we moved out of our home and when we left Mitchell and it was perfect. I work from home and the internet was super fast, kitchen was fully equipped and the TV had a RoKu that we were able to use our Direct TV subscription easily. The home was very clean and well equipped for long stays and very convenient and walkable to many bars and restaurants downtown. If we make our way back to Mitchell, we will be sure and book this fabulous place again!

The kitchen had everything we needed for our stay. The house was clean and had plenty of linens. The beds were comfortable, and the two real beds were a different firmness. So, you can pick what you want. There was a swingset in the backyard that I don't remember seeing in the photos. The kids loved it.
It is perfect for your average family vacation.
(I mention this only because I know it is nice information to know as we frequently travel with handicap family members. The home is not handicap accessible. It didn't matter to us, but if you have a wheelchair or a family member who needs assistance with hygiene routines, it will be a struggle.)

review_text: Very quaint little home! My family of five was able to take a break from the road, and get a good nights sleep here! The home has a very well-stocked kitchen, bathroom, and living area. There are books and games, and a large dining table. The king bed was a BIG plus, and all of the bedding was very comfortable. There was construction outside, but Selena was very communicative and gave us perfect directions to avoid the obstruction. The home is older construction, and the bathroom is very narrow. This wasn’t an issue for the majority of us, but my husband is a very broad man, and found it a bit difficult to maneuver in there. Not necessarily a bad thing, but something to be aware of, especially for people with limited mobility. Great stay, and would stay again!

This home is walking distance to downtown events - all the hotels are too far away so that makes this location super handy in that regard. There is only 1 bed large enough to comfortably sleep 2 people - something to keep in mind if you are planning for it to house several adult couples, bigger bodies may not be comfortable doubling up. Nice place though and would stay here again for sure!

review_text: DO NOT STAY HERE! BEWARE! I am not sure if I was misled, but the house and neighbourhood were not as expected. We did not feel safe in the house nor the neighbourhood as the back door was unlocked when we arrived, and there was yelling in the streets around the corner. Also, the pictures do not depict the condition of the house, specifically how old and dirty the kitchen is. It was one of the dingiest places we have been. I did not feel safe cooking let alone eating in there. On top of that, the house smelled of cigarettes. So, we left immediately and did not stay the night. We were not refunded for the stay, and Selena accused us as trying to scam her.

review_text:
Selena provided a great spot for us to get rejuvenated from our 3 weeks on the road. The house is well located - and the parking behind the house was wonderful for unloading and loading. The house was comfortable with a comfortable bed, smart tv and kitchen necessities.
Be aware that the bathroom is tight, but has everything you need - including information about trouble shooting any switch problems. Unlike much larger bathrooms where we have stayed, the exhaust fan was terrific and it wasn't steamy at the end of my shower - although there was plenty of hot water which I took full advantage of.
Selena was great about communicating at the beginning and end of our stay and was available via text for any questions/problems (we had none).
Thank you again Selena.

review_text:
My partner and I stayed here for one night while making our way to Rapid City to spend the holidays with family. The home was easy to find, and Selena was very communicative. Checking in and out was super easy. Lots of extra blankets around, plentiful towels and washcloths in the bathroom. The King Bed was very comfy!
Very close to Main Street restaurants and the Corn Palace, and a great value for the amount of space & having a whole place to yourself! There were standard condiments in the fridge and seasonings in the cabinets. Overall a very well stocked kitchen! There was also a little recipe box of some of Selena's favorite recipes, and recipes that other guests have left, which was such a sweet and personal feature! We didn't have time to try any of the recipes, but maybe on another trip. :)

review_text:
This place was amazing for anyone looking to get away from the hustle and bustle. Just a short drive off I-90, it was easy to get to and plenty quick to get back on the highway.
We enjoyed the beauty of the farm in the background and occasional animal noises. We gazed at the moon and then watched the sun rise the next morning.
The space was more than adequate for our family of six. Our 4 kids slept in the loft while my wife and I shared the main floor bedroom. My kids are already asking when we can go back.
I’d highly recommend Theodore’s place to anyone seeking solitude and serenity of country living.

We will definitely be staying here again if it works out with our schedule as we pass through South Dakota. What nice, peaceful place to stay!

Since it was a holiday weekend, there was not much that could be done (local repairmen were understandably unavailable). Our group had to relocate to a hotel, but George made sure Airbnb made us whole. I would absolutely stay at George’s house again, and I would recommend it to anyone.

review_text: This home is set up as a pheasant hunting lodge and has about any combination of bedding you could want or need. We 4 silver-haired old ladies in our late 70s and early 80s just don't want to have to sleep with anyone, so the 2 bedrooms with 2 twin beds each were perfect for us and no one slept in the 3rd bedroom that had, I think, a queen bed. It was nice, as well, 2 have 2 bathrooms on the main floor (one of which was 2 steps down from the kitchen into the back laundry area. All was perfect for us, and the kitchen was VERY WELL FURNISHED with about every appliance, spice, dishes you could ever want. About 1/4 mile from the owner's parents who came to check on us when we had a little difficulty connecting to the internet. (The basement had numerous beds set up as well as a well-furnished game room but not all of us even set foot in the basement.

review_text: It did not take long for us to make ourselves right at home at Jennifer's! It was the perfect place for what we needed. We met up with my sister & her family here for an overnight rest before heading off for a trip through the Badlands. The location was convenient & easy to find. Easy check in, tons of space! 7 beds in the basement we didn't even need to touch... between the the 3 bedrooms, pull out couch & chair, all 8 of us enjoyed a good night's rest upstairs. The pool table was a hit. The place is well suited for groups and caters to hunters. We felt welcome and had no questions or concerns about anything. I appreciated Jennifer's proactive communication. Comfortable place to stay and a really great place for us to meet up to kick off a fun vacation. Very grateful for the many wonderful memories that started at Jennifer's place!

This is a great spot! Its very much a farm house but conveniently located.
There were just two of us and our dogs, but there would have been room for 10 more! Great value for all of that space! The grounds were kept nice and our dogs loved running in the yard and down the road to see the cows.
Unfortunately we were too tired from our long drive to enjoy the game room downstairs, but looks like fun!
Incase you didn’t notice in the listing, dogs have to stay downstairs. And there isn’t a fenced yard, but the house sits back on a road that is pretty far from the highway, so there’s plenty of room for them to roam.
Would recommend this place to anyone! It’s not fancy, but comfy. Would be a perfect spot for a hunting group or a small family reunion.

Group trip
review_text: Definitely a hunting lodge during the pheasant season, and worked great for us out-of-season. We had a retreat here because our conference went virtual due to COVID. Great space, convenient location, kitchen with everything we needed, comfy sleeping spaces, and more than we could have asked for! TV and internet worked great. Hostess stopped by just to check in and dropped off cookies which was so nice! Gave us recommendations on a pizza place nearby that was delicious (Outback in Plankinton). We played games, had a fire, and just enjoyed country living for a week! Highly recommend and we plan to be back if we ever need a place to host another small group gathering!

name: Melissa
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2020
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: We absolutely loved everything about the house and surrounding area. Huge yard, the house is bigger than it looks in pictures, the downstairs is such a fun area to play foosball and pool or just hang out and visit, the kitchen has anything you need to make a homemade dinner, the rooms are nice and everything is just placed so well throughout the house! It gave us that feeling of home! We are a Midwest family and when I think Midwest lifestyle this home fits it to a T! The only pain point we had experienced was it did get pretty warm in there in the later afternoon/evening, but it was in the high 90's outside. However, they do supply you with plenty of fans and there were 3 AC units upstairs to try and keep it cool. It was bearable for all the adults, but we had an infant and the heat really got to him and it took a long time for him to fall asleep comfortably. But again it was very hot outside and we did have quite a few people in the house! Such a great experience though and we will totally be coming back! If you are looking for that country lifestyle experience this is definitely the place for you! Thanks again Matt!

review_text: Rebecca was an excellent host- very responsive and helpful. She left clear instructions on how to get into the house and was very friendly in all of her communications. All in all, the place felt fairly clean, other than the ant issue (which was probably due to the time of season) and we saw a pretty large spider. The neighborhood was quiet and felt pretty safe, however, the back door had a trash bag strung across the window. All in all, the house was sufficient for a one night stay as we crossed South Dakota.

review_text: We stayed overnight on our way to a vacation in the Black Hills. The home was very clean and comfortable. Kitchen seemed to be well-stocked, but we didn’t use it much, except to make coffee and quick breakfasts on our way out. Living room was cozy, and we were able to relax and watch a show together in the evenings, since we were able to log into our streaming apps easily on the TV’s Roku. Laundry room is a nice touch for longer stays, or just to wash anything that may have piled up from your travels. We loved being able to have our dog with us, and the neighborhood has plenty of sidewalks for walking her. Neighbors were friendly and waved whenever we were outside. Definitely recommend the home if you are in the area!

I will go as far to say that this home will remind you that you are important and loved:-)
Been traveling 22 months straight, staying at Airbnbs and Ben was the first and only host to gift our family with free delicious sub sandwiches from Jimmy John’s!
This was such a wonderful stay!

,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: This residence was reasonably priced. Off street parking was available. It was easily located and right behind the Corn Palace as described. We were able to book a couple hours before we arrived the same day as we were passing through Mitchell. We were provided clear instructions on how to get in, where lights were located and how to operate TV. It was decorated nicely and felt cozy. My husband and I stayed with our two teenage daughters and we all agreed it was so much nicer than staying in a hotel. Our daughters said they slept pretty well on the sleeper sofa. It was nice to be able to brew a quick cup of coffee with the provided Keurig before we got on the road again.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The Corn Palace Cottage was perfect for the 2 nights my friend and I stayed in Mitchell. We were in town visiting old friends and just needed a place to lay our heads. This place was very clean and the air conditioner worked GREAT! We had some hot days in early July in South Dakota and the AC was a huge plus! If you're interested in the Corn Palace, you are super close. You can see the back of the Corn Palace from the front porch. I highly recommend taking a short walk to a coffee place/bakery called Michelle's Mad Batter. I got a great cup of joe and some breakfast sandwiches there. If I wasn't watching my caloric intake all the time, I would have definitely tried the macaroons and the chocolate-dipped peanut butter cookies. Very friendly staff. Loved Stacey's little touches-- the granola bars especially. Cute little place!

I would definitely stay here again when I’m in Mitchell, I’m glad I found it.
Thanks for the cozy accommodations, Stacey.

Exceeded all our expectations. Amazingly clean; lots of nice little touches (even robes!), nicely decorated, etc. Lovely place.
My one piece of advice for renters is to make a note of the door code when you get your check in instructions. We didn’t, as we didn’t realize that those instructions only show up once on the app. So we couldn’t lock the door when we went to dinner. Minor issue, though. We would stay at Stacy’s place again. So much nicer than a hotel at around the same price…

Stayed one night
review_text: My husband, our dogs, and I loved staying at Stacey's place in downtown Mitchell, South Dakota. It was a one-night stop on our way to Rapid City and Hot Springs from southeastern Wisconsin, and this was the perfect location; also easy to find across from the Corn Palace! Neat and cozy vintage home, decorated very charmingly with some great amenities: robes, keurig coffee, Belvita snacks, and more. The bedroom was very spacious to put the dog crates and our stuff. No yard for dogs, however, there is a cute teeny grassy dog park next to the Corn Palace with bags and trash cans. There may be other parks to walk to, but at night the palace and area is lit up so seems safer. Stacey was easily available to communicate with before and during the visit. The whole experience was great! Actually wish we had more time to explore the area on our journey.

Group trip
review_text:
The townhouse was just what we needed for our gathering, and the space was wonderful! Destiny responded to our heat problem quickly, and it was taken care of by a friendly HVAC tech, even late into the evening!
In that a few things ( accents etc) are dated and not in good repair, the furnishings were good. The cookware was NOT good - very old and rusty, but we left a note for them to be replaced. I would check the cooking utensils for replacement as well. The neighborhood was so very quiet, and the place very soundproof!!
Thank you for the opportunity to use this facility - we will look into it again, as we have family in the area!!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The townhome was very spacious and had plenty of room for all of us especially since we were celebrating Thanksgiving there. The kitchen was well stocked. Upon checkin we noticed one of the bed frames was broken and notified Destiny right away. She responded quickly and offered to have it repaired right away. Since we didn’t need that particular bed- it was a non- issue but just wanted it noted upon our arrival.
The area is very dark at night which was great for sleeping but if you need to walk pets or are outside you may want to bring flashlights etc.
It was a great stay and would definitely stay there again.
